metadata.title: CVE-2021-34141 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
An incomplete string comparison in the numpy.core component in NumPy before1.22.0 allows attackers to trigger slightly incorrect copying byconstructing specific string objects. NOTE: the vendor states that thisreported code behavior is "completely harmless."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-34141` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python3-numpy - 1:1.24.1-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: numpy package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:1.24.1-2').
